column4: Hello, what is the parameter for gnome-terminal for auto-executing commands: i.e. gnome-terminal -X "cd foo/bar; make", thanks in advance
it's for a keybinding_command shortcut, I want to connect <Control>F9 with a make command
Oh that? You can set that up in your System => Preferences => Keyboard Shortcuts
thanks, I know how to set one up. The issue is that make -I ~/directory doesn't seem to want to work.
why don't you write a little bash script for that? You could call it as an alias from bash.
make's being an asshole in bash scripts. I can, however, get it working in terminals.
sometimes the ~ does not work, wher $HOME does
Just to confirm, I place the bash script in the same directory as my Makefile, with 'make' inside of it. Then I execute it?
No, that's not what I meant, you can use .bashrc to include this script in your path so you can call it from any directory.
You could also define an alias instead after you have made your target script executable with chmod
Sounds good, I'll give it a try
gksudo, whats the difference? Sorry, new to ubuntu.
